description: Site of a major Islamic capital that controlled the provinces of the Abbasid Empire extending from Tunisia to Central Asia for a century. Inscribed as a UNESCO World Heritage site in 2007.
details:
The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: Samarra?

Samarra is located on both sides of the River Tigris some 130 km north of Baghdad. The site remains largely unexcavated.
